summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from March-April 2019 between a U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) and FBI personnel regarding the Epstein investigation. The emails focus on logistical follow-ups concerning the scanning, transmission, and cataloging of a large volume of investigative records (16,000-29,000 pages).

persons.name: Abby
persons.context: Sends a follow-up email on March 29, 2019, asking if all materials have been uploaded to the 'W drive' regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sends an email on January 30, 2019, providing contact information and offering assistance to the FBI regarding questions about records in the Epstein investigation.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Both are communicating with the FBI about the same Epstein investigation records, indicating they are part of the same prosecutorial team from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Initial conversation about Epstein records
events.description: A conversation occurred between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI regarding records information for the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Follow-up on record scanning and transmission
events.description: A follow-up email checks on the status of transmitting scanned records (16,000-29,000 pages) to another party ('S') and requests a catalog of the materials.

events.title: Conversation about record upload
events.description: A conversation referenced in a follow-up email regarding uploading materials to a shared drive.

keyFacts: The document reveals active coordination in early 2019 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI regarding the Epstein investigation.
It references a massive volume of investigative records, specifically 16,000 to 29,000 pages that needed to be scanned, transmitted, and cataloged.
The emails indicate a sense of urgency and detailed logistical planning for handling evidence, with offers to assist 'anytime day or night'.
Multiple FBI field offices (IMD and NY) are copied on the correspondence, indicating a multi-office effort.
